cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 165 mi SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to drift NNW, then turn NW and move toward the South-North Carolina coast before curving northeast along the U.S. East Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC (includes Charleston)
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from northern Georgia through North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds of 35–45 mph with gusts to near 50 mph possible Saturday night through Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge/flooding of 1–2 ft above ground level near high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated spots up to 6 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along nearby beaches.
